tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
stu_tags: SO MANY PAPERS  TOUGH GRADER  GET READY TO READ
comments: The classes themselves were always engaging and enjoyable but the class overall was very demanding, definitely not a great class if you\'re just looking for a WID requirement as she expects a high level of writing and wants things exactly how she decides they should be. Overall, interesting but also one of the hardest classes I have taken at GW.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)

comments: One of the classes that you have to really work for. Gamble is brilliant and is well respected in her field, so she is a great resource.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
stu_tags: PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GET READY TO READ  TOUGH GRADER
comments: Avoid at all costs. Difficult grader, because she wants everyone to write in her own style, not realizing that writing is a creative art that everyone does differently. Readings never end, and you rarely even discuss them in class- but you have to read them anyway for the off chance that she brings them up. If you\'re thinking about taking her, dont

tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
stu_tags: TOUGH GRADER  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GET READY TO READ
comments: Honestly, if you\'re taking this class just because you need a WID... DO NOT DO IT! As a pre-med major, I thought epidemics in american history would be interesting. The class is a lot of reading, participation, and even though there\'s only 4 papers, THEY ARE HARD! I would say avoid this class at all costs.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Professor Gamble is an incredible professor- I took Epidemics in American History with her and it was my favorite class at GW so far. It was a lot of reading and writing but it was definitely worth it!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Professor Gamble is a brilliant professor who expects much, but rewards with good grades and recommendations if you do well. The focus of her class is definitely on student primary document research and critical analysis, which creates an extremely stimulating academic environment. However, there is a lot of writing involved.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: There\'s lots and lots of reading. SHe is really dedicated to her work. However, she isn\'t very helpful in her office hours, and that becomes a problem when you need to write a research paper (you\'re basically writing without much guidance). The TA was very helpful though.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Professor Gamble is very dedicated and educated at what she does. As a ex-Harvard teacher she expects a tremendous amount out of students. DONT be fooled, this class is the hardest class I\'ve taken at GW. Lots of reading, discussion, and papers. Learned a lot and topic is interesting but LOTS of hard work. Be ready for "heavy lifting" aka WORK!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Professor Gamble is an amazing teacher and has so much experience! I loved going to her class and I learned so much about not only the subject matter but my interests. The class is not easy but reasnable, fair and fun.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Participation matters (2)  Inspirational (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Dr. Gamble is a fascinating women and a pioneer in her field and probably the best professor I have had at GW. She is an endless source of knowledge and you can tell that she is excited to share that with you. I would take her race and health class again if I could. The class is almost completely based on articles and class discussion.
